name: Two Left Hands
description:
NOTICE: This game was made with a Godot 4.0 BETA version. As a result, some oddities may occur. Notably, at the time of this writing, the Web version WILL NOT RUN in Firefox unless you go to the direct embed page here.

Made for Github Game Off 2022, Theme "Cliche," loosely inspired by the cliche phrase "two left feet."

Imagine a world in which people have two left hands. Imagine how things would be designed in that world. Imagine the difficulties that you, (presumably) a right-hand-haver would face. Here we can take a glimpse into that world. This is Two Left Hands, a game with controls made for people with two left hands. Beat the ghosts and survive for as long as you can.

Controls (qwerty keyboard):

Move: Y, U, I, O

Dash: . (the period key)

Sword: V

Throw knife: R

Axe attack: E

Magic attack (requires full blue bar): W

Grab/Use potion: Q

UI controls for the Game Over screen are still just Arrow keys and Enter

(For those who wish to try playing this as a "normal" game, without the light commentary on accessibility in game design, I do plan on adding alternative controls after the jam rating period ends.)
